member.name: D3D11_BIND_FLAG
member.summary: Identifies how to bind a resource to the pipeline.

member.name: D3D11_BIND_FLAG.D3D11_BIND_VERTEX_BUFFER
member.summary: Bind a buffer as a vertex buffer to the input-assembler stage.

member.name: D3D11_BIND_FLAG.D3D11_BIND_INDEX_BUFFER
member.summary: Bind a buffer as an index buffer to the input-assembler stage.

member.name: D3D11_BIND_FLAG.D3D11_BIND_CONSTANT_BUFFER
member.summary: Bind a buffer as a constant buffer to a shader stage; this flag may NOT be combined with any other bind flag.

summary.para: Bind a buffer or texture to a shader stage; this flag cannot be used with the flag.
summary.div: Note The Direct3D 11.1 runtime, which is available starting with Windows 8, enables mapping dynamic constant buffers and shader resource views (SRVs) of dynamic buffers with . The Direct3D 11 and earlier runtimes limited mapping to vertex or index buffers. To determine if a Direct3D device supports these features, call with . CheckFeatureSupport fills members of a structure with the device's features. The relevant members here are MapNoOverwriteOnDynamicConstantBuffer and MapNoOverwriteOnDynamicBufferSRV.

member.name: D3D11_BIND_FLAG.D3D11_BIND_STREAM_OUTPUT
member.summary: Bind an output buffer for the stream-output stage.

member.name: D3D11_BIND_FLAG.D3D11_BIND_RENDER_TARGET
member.summary: Bind a texture as a render target for the output-merger stage.

member.name: D3D11_BIND_FLAG.D3D11_BIND_DEPTH_STENCIL
member.summary: Bind a texture as a depth-stencil target for the output-merger stage.

summary.para: Set this flag to indicate that a 2D texture is used to receive output from the decoder API. The common way to create resources for a decoder output is by calling the method to create an array of 2D textures. However, you cannot use texture arrays that are created with this flag in calls to .
Direct3D 11: This value is not supported until Direct3D 11.1.
